Key Arguments: The proposed fines represent a dramatic overreach of government authority.
The legislation could stifle dissenting journalists or media bodies.
There is ambiguity in defining what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
The fine structure disproportionately affects smaller, independent media sources.
Social media platforms may enforce arbitrary standards using machine-learning technologies that lack nuance.
The legislation poses a greater threat to free speech than the misinformation it seeks to combat.
Notable Quotes: The proposed capacity to issue fines of up to millions of dollars constitutes a dramatic overreach of government authority.
The proposed powers have the capacity of silencing any and all dissenting voices on the arbitrary grounds of ‘misinformation’, and this is a far greater threat to the safety of Australians.
